sentences.sContent: The message of the film is that good always triumphs over evil.
sentences.sCn: 这部电影的主题思想是善良终必战胜邪恶。

sentences.sContent: The result of this legal battle sends an important message to people in similar situations.
sentences.sCn: 这场诉讼战的结果给情况相似的人们传递了一个重要的信息。

sentences.sContent: It’s perfectly possible to get your message across (= communicate what you want to say ) without being so angry.
sentences.sCn: 就算不这么生气，你也完全可以把意思说清楚。

sentences.sContent: They use illustrations to convey their message.
sentences.sCn: 他们用图示来表达他们的意思。

sentences.sContent: ...A slow Response to a message could hurt not only your reputation but also your livelihood...
...The implication of this message is that people can understand each other as long as they try to do this first ; there are...
...And the message you sent was clear: you voted for action...
...You have to find a way of summarizing it so that the message is there...
...the message is that they need not be disasters...
...this saying delivers the message that if we want to truly acquire knowledge...
...The most successful environmental strategy will marry the green message to our own sense of identity...
...But this vote of confidence in Oprah sends a troubling message at precisely the time when American universities need to do more to advance the cause of reason...
...it conveys a thought- provoking message that people are exaggerating the significance of educational degrees excessively...

synos.tran: 消息；差使；启示；预言；广告词

phrases.pCn: 报警报文；报警信息；警告消息
(美国总统任期满时致国会的)最后咨文

words.tran: 消息传送；通知；信息传送

trans.tranOther: the main or most important idea that someone is trying to tell people about in a film, book, speech etc
